before zadmin and my root password has the same password
but after I changed my root password 'sudo <command>' doesn't ask the root password anymore
when logged in as zadmin why is that?
anyone could help?

Why do you want to set a root password?
I want to changed the root password different from user I used my I install the os (user: administrator)
The root password isn't set by default.  Your user's password is the password you use for sudo (again, not the root password, which doesn't exist)
It wasn't set, but then you set it, so now you can log in as root.
No, there is a root user, but it doesn't get used. It's impossible to log in as the root user.
No, 0 is the root user
1000 is just the first user created
What do you mean by "logging as root user"?  What command?
I tried changing the root password using 'sudo passwd root' and was able to do so
then I logout
when I tried to loggin as 'root' using the password I created I was able to logged in as root
Right, you can set it, but it's not set by default.  You really should disable it.
Thats because your password is cached.
`sudo passwd -l root` (thats a lowercase L)
